results.title: Music of India: drums
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of drums used in the music and dances of India. Presents the intricate compositions played on the Pakhawaj, Mridang and Tabla by renowned artists.

results.title: The Music of a modern navy
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: In a fast moving “cinema verite” style film the bands of the Royal Australian Navy play jazz, pops, country and western, Latin American and martial music. In changing locales, such as Kings Cross, Australia Square, the Royal Brisbane Show, in New South Wales country towns, on board ship and in Naval establishments they perform and entertain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations

results.title: The Music makers
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Music makers from all over Australia come each year to the National Fitness Council’s Music Camp formerly held at Geelong Grammar School. Some are professional musicians or students of music, others play only in their spare time, but all combine their talents to produce orchestras and chamber music groups. Performances by the players include selections from Handel, Sibelius and Dohnanyi. Photographed by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Music and architecture through the ages
results.brief_description: Glimpses of historic French buildings which have associations with various events in French history, together with remarks about the way in which musical instruments have been reproduced as motifs for decoration in architecture.

results.title: Mud
results.brief_description: A study of urban erosion and sedimentation caused by the careless developer or roadbuilder. Explains how engineering skills and conservation practices often applied to rural areas can be used in cities to prevent flooding and other drainage difficulties.
results.description: A study of urban erosion and sedimentation caused by the careless developer or roadbuilder. Explains how engineering skills and conservation practices often applied to rural areas can be used in cities to prevent flooding and other drainage difficulties.

results.title: Mud
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film. Close shots of a bubbling pool of thermal mud in New Zealand are matched to primeval sounds evoking the creation of a world. The sounds are composed of plucked piano bass strings, especially recorded to capture reverberation, slowed-down cymbals, xylophone, wobble board and castanets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Mount Gambier
results.brief_description: A typical Australian family living in Mount Gambier, south Australia. Shows rural agricultural and manufacturing industry of the area and features the recreational pastimes of members of the family.

results.title: Mr. Rossi on the beach
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which traces the misadventures of Mr Rossi savouring the pleasures of a seaside resort - the sand and the sea, the good food, the pretty girls. Since Mr Rossi is not easily discouraged, there are countless funny moments before we leave him bravely battling a midnight mosquito. Animation by Franco Martelli.

results.title: Mr. Rossi goes camping
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Mr Rossi’s search for a peaceful camping site leads him into hilarious encounters with bulldozers, cows and mountain-climbing motorcycles. Though not a “message” film, along with the laughter the real ecological problems come through. An animated film.

results.title: Mozart and his music
results.brief_description: The film traces the development of Mozart’s music at different periods in his life by showing the people and places which probably influenced his music; the house in Salzburg where he was born; scenes in Rome, Milan and Naples where he was acclaimed a boy genius; and Vienna where he later lived and composed some of his most important works. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: the Overture to the “Marriage of Figaro”; the First, Second and Third Movements of the Piano Concerto No. 23; the “Requiem” from the Requiem Mass; the Overture and “Batti, batti” aria from “Don Giovanni”; and the Allegro Movement from the Piano Sonata in C. Major.
